Package eventemitter

Class EventEmitter<E>

java.lang.Object
eventemitter.EventEmitter<E>
public class EventEmitter<E>
extends java.lang.Object
A very simple implementation of an event emitter, made to use Java's lambda expressions extensively.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    EventEmitter()
    Constructs an event emitter with an exception handler redirecting to `Thread.getDefaultUncaughtExceptionHandler()` if it is defined.
    EventEmitter​(java.lang.Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler ueh_)
    Constructs an event emitter by specifying the exception handler.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void addConsumer​(java.util.function.Consumer<E> c)
    Adds a consumer to the list of consumers.
    java.lang.Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler getUncaughtExceptionHandler()
    The uncaught exception handler.
    void removeConsumer​(java.util.function.Consumer<E> c)
    Removes a consumer from the list consumers.
    void trigger​(E arg)
    Triggers all consumers with the specified argument.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Constructor Details

    • EventEmitter

      public EventEmitter()
      Constructs an event emitter with an exception handler redirecting to `Thread.getDefaultUncaughtExceptionHandler()` if it is defined.

    • EventEmitter

      public EventEmitter​(@NonNull java.lang.Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler ueh_)
      Constructs an event emitter by specifying the exception handler.
      Parameters:
      ueh_ - The exception handler

  • Method Details

    • addConsumer

      public void addConsumer​(java.util.function.Consumer<E> c)
      Adds a consumer to the list of consumers.
      Parameters:
      c - The consumer

    • removeConsumer

      public void removeConsumer​(java.util.function.Consumer<E> c)
      Removes a consumer from the list consumers. If the consumer is not found in the list this operation has no effect.
      Parameters:
      c - The consumer

    • trigger

      public void trigger​(E arg)
      Triggers all consumers with the specified argument.

      Any exception occuring in a consumer will be redirected to the uncaught exception handler.

      A copy of the consumers list is created before invoking the consumers in case some consumers are added or removed during the event handling.

      Parameters:
      arg - The argument

    • getUncaughtExceptionHandler

      public java.lang.Thread.UncaughtExceptionHandler getUncaughtExceptionHandler()
      The uncaught exception handler. It is used whenever an exception is thrown in one of the consumers.
